##I'm in Quanzhou, under the rubble of a hotel, 69 hours and 33 minutes

Lifeweek

Features an introduction to a magazine and the life he advocates.

At 7:05 pm on March 7, the Xinjia hotel in Licheng district of Quanzhou City suddenly collapsed to the side of the road, trapping 71 people from 38 families. The last person trapped in the accident was found Thursday, but there were no signs of life. At this point, 112 hours after the accident, the trapped 71 people were found, 29 people were killed, 42 survived.

The last survivor to be dug up was a Wenzhounese who visited Shao Feng. At 16:38 on March 10, just before the 72-hour golden rescue period was to close, firefighters found him at the site of the collapse. Under the dark ruins, after 69 hours and 33 minutes of being trapped, you Shaofeng relies on his professional consciousness and will to survive as a safety engineer.

At 7:05 pm on March 7, the Xinjia hotel in Licheng district of Quanzhou City suddenly collapsed to the side of the road, trapping 71 people from 38 families. The last person trapped in the accident was found Thursday, but there were no signs of life. At this point, 112 hours after the accident, the trapped 71 people were found, 29 people were killed, 42 survived.

The last survivor to be dug up was a Wenzhounese who visited Shao Feng. At 16:38 on March 10, just before the 72-hour golden rescue period was to close, firefighters found him at the site of the collapse. Under the dark ruins, after 69 hours and 33 minutes of being trapped, you Shaofeng relies on his professional consciousness and will to survive as a safety engineer.

Oral | you Shaofeng

Reporters Gao Chao

It collapses in an instant

On the night of March 7th, my last night at the Jiaxin Hotel, the quarantine was about to end the next day. That afternoon, my cousin, who worked for the same company, had just returned to Quanzhou and had asked me to dinner at his house. I said I was still in quarantine, thinking we'd get together the next day.

I was on my girlfriend's laptop, Playing League of Legends with a friend. Suddenly feel the building in the light of vibration, you can hear the sound of falling glass. Seven minutes into the game, I remembered that the hero was a vampire, but the sounds outside were so disturbing that I put the game down and got up to the window to see what was going on. The whole house suddenly "Bang" Bang, my knee-jerk reaction is the window side is not safe, there is no shelter, I may be smashed to death, hurry back, the end of the game voice, friends heard me last: "The building collapsed! "

If you have time to prepare, you must hide in a corner or in a shelter. You must not hide behind a wall, because a falling wall can crush you to death. Fortunately for me, the bed, bedside table, and table in my room are just triangles. The biggest shelter in sight was the bunk, and as I ran two steps toward the triangle, the house collapsed. Two seconds into the process, the building collapses.

In fact, at this moment, I had a good basic policy: save energy, maintain the mentality, waiting for rescue. It was a knee-jerk reaction, because my cousin recommended me for my job as a safety engineer at Huishun testing group in Quanzhou. Like electrical wiring near the inventory area, easy electrical short circuit sparks; some machining equipment lathe, some workers will wear gloves operation, gloves easily involved in the lathe, very dangerous, these are what I check. The company itself as a technical service company, the security of this knowledge training is also in place, at least once a month to do a security drill, expert team is also the most elite group, are high-level engineering.

Before I came to Quanzhou, I was two years out of school and originally from the town of Taishun Turtle Lake in Wenzhou. This Spring Festival back home to catch the outbreak, Wenzhou is a disaster area, our town is zero cases of Turtle Lake. But Zhejiang is very strong in the implementation of the policy, every day there are people patrolling the streets, the home every two or three days to arrange a person to go out shopping. I apply from Alipay to the "health code" , because I have not been to other places, get the "Green Code" . Our side also pipeline, during the prevention and control of road closure, every village has a checkpoint, the first out of a general to apply for pass.

The hardest part of the isolation period is the inability to get the job done. At that time, I had a two-system construction project of safe production in a clothing city. I tend to return to clients more often, but this time I can only tell my bosses and clients that I won't be in Quanzhou for a while, that I can't get the work done, and that I have to hand it off to colleagues. Until about February 20, there is a notice that if the health code is "Green Code" , you can not apply for a pass, directly through those checkpoints, you can go out. As soon as the policy came down, I was ready to go.

So at 4:00 p.m. on February 23, I arrived in Quanzhou. Before I came here, I thought house arrest was the answer. As soon as I arrived in Quanzhou, I told the landlord that I had come back from Wenzhou, and the landlord registered with the government. Until after 3:00 p.m. on the 25th, I was in my room. After being ordered to quarantine, I took a taxi to Xinjia hotel and waited for the epidemic prevention staff to check me in. These measures are mainly aimed at the hard-hit areas such as Hubei and Wenzhou. I can understand that, but I just want to finish my stay in the hotel as soon as possible, because my work has to be inspected on the spot, and the project can not be carried out even though it is close at hand, you're just gonNA have to hurry. It was quarantined until the night of March 7, when the accident occurred. Now I call the car that drove me from my rented house to my hotel "the grim reaper. ".

It's a lot like the movies. The company's security training and my sense of professionalism did come in handy under the rubble, but I couldn't find out the details of the hotel's problems during the days of isolation. Just check in Xin Jia Hotel, I did not find anything different, the hotel decoration is good. It is hard to tell from the walls that the building is made of steel rather than concrete. Daily Disinfection, temperature is also carried out as usual, specific specifications I do not understand. My previous professional preparation was to memorize the hotel's security evacuation plan. Once in the room, I also made sure that the windows were open enough for a person to jump out at an angle, and I figured out where the air conditioning unit was and whether it could be used as an escape route for a fire. Unexpectedly, collapse faster than fire, earthquake, no time to escape. Two seconds later, I was under the rubble.

Three days and three nights under the ruins

It was completely dark under the ruins. Because my room faced the road and the building fell to this side, I was buried so deeply that the sun could not enter and I could not tell day from night. The place was full of rebar, iron, and stone, and I was covered with them because I could not see them, and could cut or cut myself if I moved.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
These three days and nights, because the sleep disorder, no light, I feel after four or five days, now I can only use the first sense, to comb those days time: The first stage is "pain" , sleep on it; the second stage is "hunger" , people are constantly being rescued; the third stage is "thirst" , and the state of mind can sometimes be a little out of balance.

It was only for a split second, and I landed with a sharp pain in my back. At first, my head was stuck on something, and the only thing that moved was my right hand. As soon as I got my head free, I pulled hard with my left hand and was free, but my feet were still pinned under the weight of the Rock, and I could only sit. I tried four or five times to remove the stone from my foot, but every time I moved the stone, my left foot felt a sharp pain. It wasn't until about 30 minutes later that I realized that the sitting posture was wearing me out, and that if I didn't move, my mind would quickly break down and I wouldn't last two days. At this point, the left foot becomes swollen from the weight of the Rock and loses consciousness. This is a good opportunity. The pain will be reduced. I clenched my teeth and, with my previously free hands, tore open the stone of one foot and kicked it away with the other. The hardest part of the procedure, I had to do it myself, and that was, like, the highest level of pain.

Once my limbs were free to stretch, my first choice was to sleep and conserve my energy. I lay down and empty my mind. I woke up with less pain in my back. Because of the dust around, the dust and the blood flow out of the union, the foot wound scarring quickly. I could hear rescue teams up there already digging, the sound of diggers, and other survivors shouting for help. I started looking around for my cell phone and mineral water, but nothing came of it. Finally I found some foam tiles from the ceiling, which I put on my back because they were smooth and comfortable to sleep on. Inside, I felt like I was under an SUV, and I could barely lift my waist to the top. I can lie down, but I can't stand, I can't squat, I can only do that.

During the "hungry" phase, I had interaction with the trapped people around me. I was impressed by a young lady who lived next door to me, 403. We had a conversation, i said, "are you okay? " "My side is fine! " "hold on! Someone will come to save us! " "Okay. " Just simple communication, it's a waste of energy. And about the day before I was rescued, a rescue team passed by upstairs, and I heard a girl crying and shouting: "Uncle Help me, mom and Dad Miss Me. " I advised her to save her strength. I don't know if she heard me, the firemen found her a moment later. The voices of these strangers came from above, they were being rescued, and I was buried at the bottom of the pile. I'm happy on one side, because they're all gone, and I'm next, right? And a little upset. Why didn't I cry? Maybe he cried. Maybe he saved me.

At the "thirst" stage, I finally understand the word "thirst" , "thirst" is really difficult. There was a mother and her child above me who were very lucky, and there was mineral water right next to them, so I had nothing. The State of thirst, people are most likely to collapse. I had wasted my energy desperately searching for mineral water; I had sucked every pipe I could find under the rubble, hoping it was a pipe; until the rainy night of March 9th, when the air became moist, i realized I could draw water from the air. I took some gauze from the bed that I had been protecting, and I moistened it with urine, and I put it in the side of my nose to increase the moisture around it. Thirst sometimes produces some laughing and crying dreams: sometimes dream of being rescued, who do not know me, I still look around for water to drink.

Alive

With no access to water, I tried to empty myself. There's tons of free time down there. I feel like my whole life, every moment you can think of, I've been thinking about it. When we were kids, we used to go fishing and catch birds. In the fourth grade, when my father was disabled in a car accident and my mother had to go out to earn money, I became independent. School was in town, home was in the village, and there was a long walk between, so I'd been living on campus since the fourth grade. School to bring their own lunch boxes, their own rice, carrying a week on Sunday to eat a bag of rice, walk to school. I had these images in my head.

In the ruins of the most can not think of those you are most reluctant to give up the people and things. I touched something that looked like a keyboard. It was a piece of my girlfriend's computer. I had borrowed it to play a game at the hotel because my desktop was in the rental room. She is from Xiamen, with a Double in her name. I call her Double. When I came out of there, I was like, "Double, I'm alive, I'm fine, " and I called her and she started crying. But in the ruins, I touch this piece of keyboard, it will be thrown far away, can not think, will become vulnerable.

I later learned that my mother, cousin, cousin and two uncles were in the house. At the Isolation Hotel, a family anxiously watches the live broadcast from two mobile phone screens. My uncle usually smoke a pack or two a day, these days half a pack did not finish, eat a meal also immediately vomited. As soon as rescue one informed him that the photos of the victims would be sent to him, his uncle said that his legs were all weak, and he immediately ran to his bed and cried. After crying, he then turned over the photos one by one in a shaky manner. The photos were A4 paper. Each time he turned over a piece of paper, his eyes were closed, run it through your head, see if it's me. No, just throw it away and flip over the next one. What impressed him most, he said, was a young man in white clothes, who came out unrecognisable except for a white coat and trousers. When I left the House, I was wearing a white dress, and he panicked, and it can't be me. Then he found out they were panda-striped Pyjama Pants, which I didn't own, so he was sure it wasn't me. And My mother, also has been lying in bed, the family looked at the quilt in twitch, she was crying.

I was buried in the rubble for so long, it would be an exaggeration to say that I didn't break down for a second. In the end, my lifeline was an air conditioner remote control. The screen of the remote control glows, and I use the light to shine around: It's a space about the same height and area as the undercarriage of an SUV, but not a regular rectangle, various pieces of furniture and structures split the interior into a convergent polygon, like a chicken claw. To maintain my mental state, I imagined a two room room room with a living room in the middle, where I could talk to the trapped people around me. The master bedroom was larger, but it was drafty and cold at night, when I moved to the second bedroom. I also found a battery pack, thinking that the remote had a spare when the original battery ran out, but soon found out the irony: Could I outlive this battery? So I played with the screen of the remote control, watching the interface changes, killing time.

This continued until the early hours of March 9, when I heard a knock from above, thinking that this would be saved, and went to sleep. A wake up, but surprisingly quiet above, waiting for a long time no one back, my heart a cold, I may feel wrong.

I woke up about every half hour after 12 noon that day. I heard the rescuers come by and shout into the microphone. I shouted back, but the rescuers couldn't hear me. So I started knocking, and the rescuers said, somebody knock twice. I'll do it. At this time I found the hope of life, this time I was really found, I do not spare, a little bit of strength do not want to keep, feel free to call

"where are you from? " "Wenzhou! " "What's your name? " "You! Shao! Feng! "

Then the ruins were cut into a small round hole, first sent out the significant piece of remote control, and then me. When I came out from below, I felt strong all of a sudden. I could even walk by myself, but the rescue uncle was so strong that a princess lifted it up for me. He was then taken on a stretcher and taken to the hospital. On the way, I looked at the familiar south ring road, a few seconds to the hospital. I thought this was the Quanzhou Hospital on the South Ring Road, but the nurse told me that this was the first hospital in Quanzhou, already in the downtown area. I don't know if my reflexes are slowing down or if the ambulance is going too fast.

I first time to still in the home, the body inconvenient father called. He was the one I was worried about the most, and I was the most important thing to him. Dad didn't eat or drink for a few days. I couldn't forget his voice on the phone. "Son, it's all right now. It's all right. You have a good rest. "

I'm the 10th person from the bottom of the pile. When I came out, I watched the news, and six or seven of them were dead, and nine of them were dead, so I'm pretty sure I'm the last one alive. Until now, the thought of the victims has made me sick: We came to work, hoping to be quarantined at home, only to be quarantined in a hotel, at our own expense, and reluctantly, we all cooperated. I didn't realize the hotel was such a security risk.

I'm grateful to the first responders for their day and night work, to our company's safety training and professional development, and to the doctors and nurses who helped me. I couldn't have survived without them. In the ruins I often have multiple dreams: was rescued, no one knows me, woke up to find it was a dream, was rescued, I looked everywhere for water, the result is a dream, layer upon layer. And now it's finally over, and I'm surrounded by people who care about me.

(photo courtesy of@Fujian; for an in-depth report on the Quanzhou Hotel Collapse, see the March 18 issue of Sanlian Life Weekly.)
